msContents.summary: Account; twenty columns of a ledger recording payments for the syntaximon

msItemStruct.note: Written across the fibers; on the recto, accounts for syntaximon (P.Princ. 8)
The hand is a small, rapid cursive
In several places, near the beginning and the end of the roll, the ink has faded

Col. (i) 8 lines; col. (ii) 32 lines; col. (iii) 38 lines; col. (iv) 9 lines; col. (v) 39 lines; col. (vi) 19 lines; col. (vii) 35 lines; col. (viii) 37 lines; col. (ix) 9 lines; col. (x) 23 lines; col. (xi) 39 lines; col. (xii) 40 lines; col. (xiii) 39 lines; col. (xiv) 40 lines; col. (xv) 42 lines; col. (xvi) 36 lines; col. (xvii) 34 lines; col. (xviii) 34 lines; col. (xix) 33 lines; col. (xx) 4 lines
On the other side of the papyrus is P.Princ. I 8

taxonomy.desc: APIS keywords are controlled locally at the institution level. They are not necessarily consistent.

div.ab: [col. I] Mechir. Records in the bank. [col. II] Those in charge of expenses; likewise spent; Horos s. of Mysthas 4 dr.; [l. 5] to Melankomas s. of Ischyrion 2 dr.; to Platon s. of Pachnoubis 4 dr.; 19th of the month of Theogeneios, 3rd (year?), at the bank, Thermouthis s. of Psenamounis; from (?) Psammis s. of Syros, on account of wheat 29 1/4 1/16 artabas; of which 1/2 1/3 1/12. [col. III] [l. 10] expenses [drawn] at the [bank] through Nemesion; to Herakles s. of Petesouchos 4 dr.; . . . 8 dr.; . . . s. of Antiphil- 4 dr. ; in that at Hiera Ptol- 2 dr.; [l. 15] total 18 dr.; to Achillas 20 dr.; to Dionytas s. of Pe- 4 dr.; to Eisapollon, armed guard of wine, 8 ob.; to Maron . . . 4 dr.; [l. 20] for fodder 3 ob.; for the price of the sweatmeats 3 1/2 ob.; to Heron, collector, 3 ob.; to Maron and (?) Isidoros 10 ob.; for dates 3 ob.; [l. 25] account given through Papontos 10 dr.; to Didymas s. of Antiphilos 8 dr.; to Aphrodisios, armed guard, monthly total 8 dr.; likewise for wages 48 dr.; likewise for other expenses 8 dr.; [l. 30] for the price of bramble-berry shoots 3 dr. 3 ob.; to . . . 4 dr.; to Heron, armed guard 1 ob.; to the same 17 dr.; for the price of wheat 6 dr.; [l. 35] expenses for epixena; at Ptolemais Nea, for the price of meat 3 dr. 2 ob.; travel money of an armed guard 80 dr.; in Ptolemais Nea, through Maron 20 dr.; to Horion, armed guard 1 dr.; [l. 40] other expenses 100 dr.; to the same 4 dr. [col. IV] to slaves collecting claims 2 dr.; to herald 12 dr.; to servants 4 dr.; [l. 45] [[to slaves 2 dr.]]; to Papees for the price of dates 2 dr.; to Adrastos 4 ob.; for vegetables zyt- 4 ob.; for tach- chre- 8 dr.; [l. 50] to scribe 60 dr.; to Dionytas 8 dr. to Hermes 8 dr.; for scribeâ€™s salary 14 dr.; to Petesouchos s. of Hegemon 24 dr.; [l. 55] for the price of wine 4 dr.; for one papyrus roll 1 dr.; likewise for the price of reeds 4 dr.; for the price of dates 3 dr. total, in silver 124 dr.; [l. 60] to Rufus 4 dr.; for the price of meat 2 dr.; for armed guards assigned to Polemon meris 40 dr.; for another expenditure; to Petesouchos s. of Hegemon, through Maron 124 dr.; [l. 65] to scribe 13 dr. 3 ob.; to the chief of armed guards 4 dr.; in Boukolon; [[to Platon s. of Pachnoubis 2 dr.]]; [[Horos s. of Morseus 6 dr.]]; [l. 70] [[Horos s. of Mysthas 13 dr. 2 ob.]]; of which expenditures; to Euboulos 13 dr. 2 ob.; to Petesouchos s. of Isoun 1 ob.; to Kephalon 1 ob.; [l. 75] to the slaves ob.; to armed guard and (?) scribe 2 dr.; to Petesouchos partner of Achillas 2 dr.; likewise for expenditures 32 dr.; to Ptolemaios, armed guard 8 dr. [col. V] [l. 80] From Maron 12 dr.; for fodder 2 ob.; for the likewise ob.; and expenses through Maron 2 dr.; to Maron who is exempt from dike tax 14 dr.; [l. 85] other to Petesouchos s. of Hegemon 28 dr.; to Ptolemaios, scribe ob.; for fodder 4 ob.; to armed guard 1 dr. [col. VI] To Maron, from which he gave; [l. 90] to the account of stone masonry 40 dr.; Onnophris, priest 7 ob.; Onnophris s. of Moueris 7 ob.; Onnophris s. of Pataas 7 ob.; Harphaesis s. of Cheousis 4 ob.; [l. 95] Petanoupis s. of Apynchis 3 ob.; Herakles s. of Horos 5 ob.; Pylades s. of Herakles 5 ob.; Panetbeus s. of Harmaios 5 ob.; Petesouchos s. of Harmaios 7 ob.; [l. 100] Laertes s. of Harphaesis 7 ob.; Apollonios s. of Anoubion 4; Apis weaver 6 ob.; Pankrates the younger s. of Haryotes 7 ob.; Herakles s. Psenamounis 7; [l. 105] Ibion s. of Marres 3 ob.; Onnophris s. of Peteamounis 7 ob. Polyphantes s. of Polyphantes 7 ob.; Apollonios s. of Phanomgeus 7 ob.; Pasion s. of Herakles 6; [l. 110] Pnepheros s. of Petermouthis 7; Orsenouphis, weaver 2 ob.; Horion s. of Ptolemaios 6; Pomas [[s. of Akes]] 7; Petesouchos s. of Theanios 6; [l. 115] Herakles s. of Pauesis 7; likewise Herakles 7; Pankras s. of Onnophris 7; Ischis s. of Doras 14; Ischyrion s. of Kallis 7; [l. 120] Syros s. of Syros 14; Harphaesis s. of Hergeus 2; Ptolion s. of Mysthas 2; Tethautis 6 half-obols; Theon s. of Ptollis 3; [l. 125] Petermouthis s. of Peteesis 3; Esouris s. Pomsais 7; Herieus s. of Herieus, copper-smith 7. [col. VII] Petsiris Archonides 7; Panoueites [[s. of Anchor]] s. of Panchrates 7; [l. 130] Haronnophris s. of Heras 5; Athenion 7; Petermouthis s. of Phanomgeus 7; Herakles s. of Petesouchos, donkey-driver 7; Pnepheros s. of Harphaesis 7; [l. 135] Phabis s. of Straton 21; Ptermouthis s. of Phanomgeus 21; Anoubion s. of Papontos 7; Onnophris s. of Onnophris, weaver 21; Apynchis s. of Pomsais 7; [l. 140] Herakles s. of Ischyrion 7; Kallis s. of Hatres 7; Belles s. of Esouris 7; Phasis s. of Labatas 2; Herakles s. of Mysthas 7; [l. 145] Theon s. of Herakleides 4 dr.; Theon s. of Haryotes 4 dr. [col. [col. IX] [[at Astar]] at Arsinoe; Herieus s. of Harphaesis 6 dr.; Sisois s. of E- 8 dr.; [l. 185] Apollonios s. of Nekpheros 6 dr.; Nekpheros the son 6 dr.; Pachnoubis [ ] 6 dr.; Orsenouphis s. of Paneis 6 dr.; for the epixena; [l. 190] at Andrianton 13 dr. 4 ob.; at Kerkesouchon; Ptollis s. of Besas 6 dr.; Besas s. of Besas 6 dr.; Pnepheros s. of Phanomgeus 6 dr.; [l. 195] Petesouchos s. of Panomgeus 6 dr.; at Nestos, Panetbeus s. of Panetbeus 6 dr.; Papontos, his brother 6 dr.; Herakles, another brother 6 dr.; Hegemon, another 6 dr.; [l. 200] Praxias s. of Sisois 6 dr. [col.
